Wisdom: ابْدَأْ بِالْعَطِيَّةِ مَنْ [لِمَنْ‏] لَمْ يَسْأَلْكَ وَابْذُلْ مَعْرُوفَكَ لِمَنْ طَلَبَهُ وَإِيَّاكَ أَنْ تَرُدَّ السَّائِلَ
enWisdom: Start by giving the one who has not asked you, and extend your favour to the one who has sought it, and be cautious never to turn away a beggar

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَصُنْ وَجْهَهُ عَنْ مَسْأَلَتِكَ فَأَكْرِمْ وَجْهَكَ عَنْ رَدِّهِ
enWisdom: When one does not protect his dignity from [the humiliation of] asking you, then preserve your honour by not turning him away

Wisdom: مِنَ الْوَاجِبِ عَلَى ذِي الْجَاهِ أَنْ يَبْذُلَهُ لِطَالِبِهِ
enWisdom: One of the obligations of a person who possesses a high rank is to use it to grant the [needs of] one who seeks from him
Never turn away the beggar, even if he exceeds the limits

Wisdom: لَا تَرُدَّ السَّائِلَ وَصُنْ مُرُوَّتَكَ عَنْ حِرْمَانِهِ
enWisdom: Do not turn away the beggar and safeguard your magnanimity by not depriving him
Do not deprive the distressed even if he is extravagant

Wisdom: يَسِيرُ الْعَطَاءِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ التَّعَلُّلِ بِالاعْتِذَارِ
enWisdom: Giving little is better than offering excuses [for not giving]
